elements.2211.03215_24022dc06c10f22698f448e6f8653: The Hofstadter butterfly is one of the first and most fascinating examples of the fractal and self-similar quantum nature of free electrons in a lattice pierced by a perpendicular magnetic field
elements.2211.03215_bad1f8b8ad07f558ad74bbda37ac6: However, the direct experimental verification of this effect on single-layer materials is still missing as very strong and inaccessible magnetic fields are necessary
elements.2211.03215_89c4a3d98e033485a77bb6f7e4877: For this reason, its indirect experimental verification has only been realized in artificial periodic 2D systems, like moirÃ© lattices
elements.2211.03215_2ead7489aa433a6e29a2f29b3fc09: The only recently synthesized 2D covalent-organic frameworks might circumvent this limitation: Due to their large pore structures, magnetic fields needed to detect most features of the Hofstadter butterfly are indeed accessible with today technology
elements.2211.03215_fe76960f8fce06d46a8eeb9f0dd17: This work opens the door to make this exotic and theoretical issue from the 70s measurable and might solve the quest for the experimental verification of the Hofstadter butterfly in single-layer materials
elements.2211.03215_802f947af37c108e54c2e8fc6d390: Moreover, the intrinsic hierarchy of different pore sizes in 2D covalent-organic framework adds additional complexity and beauty to the original butterflies and leads to a direct accessible playground for new physical observations.
elements.2211.03215_97cd6021be178b6677fdfc0ec1d6d: The quantum behavior of an electron moving in a two-dimensional lattice exposed to a magnetic field is a fundamental problem of solid-state physics that has been studied deeply in the 70s
elements.2211.03215_4ca605ad95d19e5f0f2bdc9fccfbd: By plotting for the first time the allowed energies of the electrons and varying the magnetic field, Douglas Hofstadter found the stunning form of a graph that consists of duplicates of itself, embedded infinitely deeply, and that encodes nature in such a complex but equally self-similar manner.
elements.2211.03215_bb6a25d9b8408c66fc8c81b20909e: This so-called Hofstadter butterfly (HB), which is shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_c10d8f93d9b04c5f48361d9c9e66a: a and b, emerges from the commensurability of the magnetic and the lattice lengths when constraining a free electron onto a lattice
elements.2211.03215_7833a64f67b85cd9581c5680f2b49: This effect has fascinated theoretical physicists and mathematicians over many decades
elements.2211.03215_0469c69970126873232a354fda1fa: \cite{Rammal_1985, Gumbs_1997, Koshino_2001, Osadchy_2001, Xiao_2003, Nemec_2006, Nemec_2007, Ylmaz_2017,Ferrari_2015}
elements.2211.03215_8059b43230fff9af0b6de8ca712e9: and connects the mathematical concept of fractals with the world of physics by encoding the most exotic behaviors of quantum mechanics and topology, namely the quantum Hall effect and conductance quantization in 2D materials.
elements.2211.03215_fa2df8692cde6bad8975ff6f4fc95: However, the minimal magnetic field strength,
elements.2211.03215_146cd248de256706cc3a3e519d45f: , for resolving HBs depends inversely on the plaquette area
elements.2211.03215_e64f05c6571517ef1cf75472e77d7: of a lattice closed loop, such as a hexagon in a honeycomb lattice,
elements.2211.03215_f3d3c524dcf063c4b39194f498f12: The HB repeats itself infinitely with a period of
elements.2211.03215_eb24d9c64ff09c1352371d4a94a65: kT, making it inaccessible for experimental validation
elements.2211.03215_6751c41251f9cca8df2683658cd62: Hence, the HB has served since its discovery as a physical playground of mainly theoretical interest but with no direct observation
elements.2211.03215_58cc3e19ab9ee2455aa4175b5e0ad: However, in the last three decades experimental verification of the HB via artificial lattices with very large unit cells, such as moirÃ© lattices or 2D electron gas lattices, has turned this once-theoretical issue into an active field in experimental solid-state physics nowadays.
elements.2211.03215_36ce5c1fcd86e4845ae0e03ef4b76: It was only the escamotage of artificial lattices, like moirÃ© patterns, resulting in large plaquette areas which enabled the first indirect experimental demonstration of HB through magnetotransport measurements.
elements.2211.03215_eb5fea1e4a419539b37513a0370c8: Two-dimensional covalent-organic frameworks (2D COFs), however, have not yet been at the center of such investigations and we can show that they indeed could be the first single-layered material to directly observe HBs
elements.2211.03215_7ced442bd696b36000c904db98096: COFs are crystalline covalently bound organic polymers that have first been successfully synthesized in 2005.
elements.2211.03215_e2b7368cf805816b497dd1ab78d20: The crystalline polymers are constructed from organic building block molecules attached to each other in a regular fashion which creates a periodic and often porous structure as depicted in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_3f83d8c8eeb4e73b47db8fa894263: Due to the many available types of precursor molecules, various different structures with tunable properties are possible
elements.2211.03215_87379b7b731764c487f6f7a43db83: As a result, COFs have gained ever since a lot of attention in the polymer and solid state community.
elements.2211.03215_d68122e83e63df7ba8d4f98348f46: Many COFs are layered materials, similar to the graphene sheets in graphite, but experimental methods have been refined to create few-layer and indeed monolayer 2D COFs.
elements.2211.03215_3b5cead091f491e3d65f250e59f4c: These are based on simpler lattice types, like honeycomb or hexagonal lattices, with usually very large unit cells
elements.2211.03215_e5006ca6c5a23efccc40843e43260: This would lead to a lower magnetic field required for the experimental validation of the HB
elements.2211.03215_750d29d4e0c578d1cdc1eb685dd3f: Additionally, it has been shown how in these materials the lattice topology itself mediates electronic and mechanical properties.
elements.2211.03215_33fb7cdb20a299d0aa5c1ae80c3bb: Moreover, recent investigations of topological effects in 2D COFs showed their potential as topological materials.
elements.2211.03215_090b0da101bd628b877a054b1390d: All of this makes 2D COFs interesting materials for the exploration of fractality, quantum effects and finally finding a HB at experimentally viable magnetic fields
elements.2211.03215_1d8abcefb2a63e3642fc00a5a8a55: is depicted, including known 2D COFs with honeycomb, tetragonal or square lattice structure
elements.2211.03215_a2b2e9e8d1ccc80ee7d72741d16e4: This shows that several COFs already exist where the HB can be measured to a great extent with experimentally achievable magnetic fields
elements.2211.03215_b05bfd6fdb3469a8010c3e2b75dc1: as comparison, which is twice the highest achievable continuous magnetic field (
elements.2211.03215_624f546436df6fe74924191197082: ), as the HB is symmetric in the magnetic field and consequently only half of its spectrum needs to be measured
elements.2211.03215_0199d5a453acdd9c3a41546551e47: Additionally, a greater complexity and a richer phenomenon of the HB is expected due to COFs rich pore hierarchy
elements.2211.03215_332f51447263587ce5dcdbab18a8b: The HB for three different exemplary 2D COFs (shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_9bb5edec8d8050e5e36f7c0de30d0: d) are calculated in the following: complex hierarchical patterns and fractal HBs can be observed at measurable magnetic fields.
elements.2211.03215_76d7d39f27ae50eb1389960fb9f88: shows the well-known COF-5 with its three different plaquette types marked as
elements.2211.03215_48fa0e24ddca57166bf8524c2789e: COF-5 is the first synthesized and one of the most studied COF which has, just like graphene, a honeycomb lattice as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_7728b58a64bfe66dac84c82dd3ef2: As the HB repeats itself with a period of
elements.2211.03215_c478973fce00c4b364f778333e3e9: , we search for a reoccurring pattern in the calculated spectrum
elements.2211.03215_77cc290cc64bb70ea6715613d0e00: c, one can see such a pattern with a period of approximately 240
elements.2211.03215_c37d8c3a8524c3fd7fbb320bca761: This spectrum, however, does not resemble the HB of an equivalent honeycomb lattice (Fig.
elements.2211.03215_330d83d7822057354a9384ffecd12: b) and its period is very large
elements.2211.03215_5f256966aa81164af6a4d44cca01f: A zoom into the spectrum, as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_657c1e762eea140f8ffec113489be: d, indicate more complex patterns and a further zoom in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_e1e4147950ea3c6c84c73b85bd9b4: e reveals astonishingly a HB that is equivalent of the one of graphene, but only at 528.7
elements.2211.03215_9cb1f9be57fc3172fbd4e85337ffa: To avoid confusion in the following discussion, we will call the patterns that resemble the HB of simple lattices specifically "HB" and the rest of the spectrum generally "butterfly spectrum"
elements.2211.03215_7ee96b6aa31dda5537f19f35283a4: How can we understand the formation of different patterns on the various scales of magnetic fields? As seen in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_e119821fe08452be1e5f1b0964103: c, the butterfly spectrum contains many different "bands" that change with the magnetic field
elements.2211.03215_a870a62d2eb1b8eb74178bf15757a: We will call those "ribbons" to give a clear distinction to bands in band structure plots
elements.2211.03215_935f66afbd70618efb6395dc498ef: This complexity arises due to the numerous electronic states that COFs have compared to simple lattices
elements.2211.03215_10a237808617cb3e39a57f65ec193: A zoom closer to some of the ribbons in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_bcd2db3877c21cc0cf8bd156f297f: d, shows that each ribbon itself contains many smaller complex features that sometimes overlap and interfere with each other and create new patterns.
elements.2211.03215_fdf5e6b187b9cdc3c0132d0ba0c62: A comparison with the band structure in SI
elements.2211.03215_bfff6ca8b77a609a12451c97b9d86: 2 reveals that some ribbons are based on a band-structure equivalent of a simple honeycomb lattice, while others are more similar to the one of a kagome lattice
elements.2211.03215_822e0234ac6396767704cfb0cc13c: It is known that COF-5 has kagome-characteristic bands.
elements.2211.03215_65df526f49515f1dbbe122a9aeea4: The resulting butterfly spectrum of these kagome-like bands is similarly distorted as the one of a simple kagome-lattice HB.
elements.2211.03215_8496920c3b7f3ced5dab492a26487: Furthermore, a comparison of the band-structure and HBs of all studied COFs in this manuscript is shown in SI
elements.2211.03215_96c752a4d886a0323268196628197: e into the isolated ribbon at around -6.9
elements.2211.03215_bd3ee2f72676a57831d5de1ac0015: This shows that the lattice type itself dictates the electronic structure and topological effects
elements.2211.03215_ca27db05f48471faaff9fa11cb6bc: A key difference to the HB in a simple honeycomb lattice is that HB in COF-5 is strictly speaking not repeating itself, but is distorted for higher magnetic fields due to the superposition of different periodicities.
elements.2211.03215_6a3a9fbfdab76527f466b25e74543: But why do we see a periodic pattern at approximately 240
elements.2211.03215_c925c8bff7f5af49d1b6cbf209dc4: c for COF-5? This value does not coincide with any of the
elements.2211.03215_518fcd5a3de600bcc8777f1453dbf: values of the three plaquette types
elements.2211.03215_740a7d89eb382cfcd313d8fbfefdb: and the boronic ester based five-membered ring
elements.2211.03215_c83b93e94de3899dd6f6fd93e2927: As the latter two periods have approximately a common denominator, a new periodic pattern with a bigger period at approximately 240
elements.2211.03215_aa6ec155ab5a8c5fda4076b13895e: To better understand the influence of multiple plaquette types on the butterfly spectrum, we next investigate a COF with four different plaquettes
elements.2211.03215_a139f49f54d8256841989a5893048: This COF is based on Phthalocyanine as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_30742800fbbad6b7e7dbcd8695abc: a and has a square lattice
elements.2211.03215_691a1a5274f00c1fffb7bc9d30d89: It has been shown in previous studies that this COF has interesting topological properties, although usually investigated including a metal-center.
elements.2211.03215_65c8853c2ca4fdf3fe09c6de31c0a: a, we depict the four different kinds of plaquettes marked as
elements.2211.03215_faefc309647507f5a27beb4aa5204: : square lattice plaquette that arises from the fused Phthalocyanines units
elements.2211.03215_155b64b12ded3006aa7b0dedbaa52: , the pore inside of a Phthalocyanine unit
elements.2211.03215_d669946a63ff432a03b4dd436637b: d, we can see that similar to COF-5, there is an overlap of the periodicities of
elements.2211.03215_48974664d555b46157ebc374d834e: kT) that lead to a new combined pattern with a period of approximately 240
elements.2211.03215_b1f73774e983906d977ef01354c96: The spectrum shows that there are patterns with different periods which are marked in the figure
elements.2211.03215_c42a67c370aad69b8ce7fbc62c6d1: For better visualization of the repeating patterns, a wider magnetic field range of the butterfly spectrum plotted in SI
elements.2211.03215_45d0e1720c579cfef529fcea9ac2f: When zooming into one of the ribbons in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_e93e1babe9c8e2ebec9b449218f66: d, we see as expected a HB in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_5d0306e8c1ae94c3f78d2c4e81bc4: c that resembles the one of a square lattice (compare to Fig.
elements.2211.03215_3daad52b803679f04245134f00757: a, which further shows how lattice types guides topological effects like the HB
elements.2211.03215_97f50423fea93637a908901643518: is only around five times larger than
elements.2211.03215_2fb589077fe67bd0e775da3b7071a: From this we can see that the closer the scales of periodicities of different plaquettes are, the more they influence each other and the more distorted the HB is
elements.2211.03215_c9865e5148dd3182bf4f54b587af5: We would like to point out that the fractality and the actual HB is only created by the lattice plaquette, i.e. the biggest plaquette
elements.2211.03215_8837ba49517b5737902f4c4202e11: The other plaquettes are only responsible for additional periodicity, but not for fractality, as shown in SI
elements.2211.03215_d90044ddd3ca15e4e2a6e97437e15: The COFs investigated so far do not have large enough unit cells to create a periodicity
elements.2211.03215_2128ec88778854ae6b717f992070e: that would be measurable in today's experiments
elements.2211.03215_a7ec6a3dc0a3afc9b79eb6dbc70af: Hence, a COF with larger pores is required
elements.2211.03215_cd477e90147ba9b07195cd59dd43d: One COF (COF-122) exists already that is close to the required unit cell size.
elements.2211.03215_4ee76454f9a4a8a8a44960cc6ce90: However, as parts of this COF have many rotational degrees of freedom and is hence not flat, it is in our opinion not suitable for a flat monolayer material
elements.2211.03215_f8891a0618792d3569dd88b2924fa: For this reason, we propose a COF that is based on the recently reported class of Starphene molecules which are triangular molecules of fused benzene rings.
elements.2211.03215_7c5d83a17b151354c3c3ba8227303: When connected, a highly porous COF with a honeycomb lattice would result which we call Starphene-COF, as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_ac9514710c83e657509933b6c2e48: This theoretical COF also is a fully conjugated system which should lead to a good conductivity
elements.2211.03215_ad2f152d1b7d8af896dc2184a74b3: In the Starphene-COF, there are only two plaquette types: the honeycomb lattice plaquette
elements.2211.03215_795c48cc88c4306a083f2b2091641: This leads to a period of 133.8
elements.2211.03215_2d62deba9eafed6eb1445bc74a914: The full butterfly spectrum up to 80
elements.2211.03215_104ce311729eca2f3034b75de914a: c, we zoom in to the magnetic field range of the smaller period and see that a HB arises that looks similar to the one of a simple honeycomb lattice in Fig.
elements.2211.03215_244ea3df477ab3ada57cbacdae458: T, the HB of the Starphene-COF would be accessible to a great extent by available magnetic fields, possibly solving the quest for direct experimental verification of the HB in a single layer 2D material in the future
elements.2211.03215_9893abca7b37e29d14f719d255142: d also has some interesting properties similar to a related class of materials, graphene antidot lattices (GALs) which is graphene with periodic holes
elements.2211.03215_4725e54c5db73b2cbe135c664c7a0: In GALs, a typical graphene HB pattern still emerges, even though it becomes less distinct the bigger the holes in the lattice becomes
elements.2211.03215_45a27feefa9bf1fb73e116597848d: The Starphene-COF can be seen as an edge case of such a GAL, in the sense of a porous graphene which has the biggest possible hole for its repeating unit
elements.2211.03215_b08ccbb0a60ebd6ad91500704db0f: Another feature that is known from GALs is that the band gap is being quenched with increasing magnetic field, which can be seen for the Starphene-COF at around 6
elements.2211.03215_0f8edad756a88aee84961f5051442: During the preparation of the manuscript, a novel COF with a very large pore was reported.
elements.2211.03215_dec13af3d8da51f0b2a98ce8d5395: 1 the corresponding HB that is resolved at 122.6
elements.2211.03215_7cdf2f35427d10a2dfa294daea557: T, which is even lower than our proposed Starphene-COF
elements.2211.03215_8ad06ec9fc4ae9705e7cdf2bb4444: This demonstrates how the rapid advances in synthesis can provide systems to experimentally measure the HB in the near future.
elements.2211.03215_3e401f2a994f0d80086ca204b38f6: We have shown that 2D COFs are promising materials for the direct experimental verification of the Hofstadter butterfly in pure 2D materials and that there are additional hierarchical patterns that are not present in HBs of simple lattices
elements.2211.03215_859ee0d89633c3e5adcfffb03bb84: This work might turn this merely-theoretical issue from the 70s into an active experimental research activity nowadays and trigger the race for the first direct measurement
elements.2211.03215_e972e9e0ff54091b38936c1d56b2a: We found equivalents of simple lattice HB inside the complex and beautiful butterfly spectra of 2D COFs
elements.2211.03215_02ba78fecf5421f2fba936c8ad278: Moreover, hierarchical structures and periodicities can be found within these spectra, due to the various pore types inside a single COF-structure, opening a new dimension for novel physics
elements.2211.03215_9d0c6c5788be6b2a017c82e0cc84b: Furthermore, we showed that for 2D COFs with large unit cells the magnetic field to measure a HB is small enough to be experimentally viable. 2D COFs can provide the ideal playground for the investigation of such fundamental quantum effects and the recent advances in single-layer synthesis of 2D COFs will lead in the foreseeable future to the direct observation of the Hofstadter butterfly in a single-layer 2D material.
